flawed_nl_solution:
In the first store, each apple costs $3/6 = $<<3/6=0.43>>0.43.
In the second store, each apple costs $4/10 = $<<4/10=0.4>>0.4.
So, you can save $0.43 - $0.4 = $0.03 on each apple from buying $4 for 10 apples than from $3 for 6 apples.
In cents, this is equal to $0.03 x 100 = <<0.03*100=3.22>>3.22.
